description:
Comments are an easy way to let other programmers
know what you are doing without displaying code on the front end.
You always need an opening and closing comment to
indicate which block should not be displayed.
Any text within the opening and closing comment blocks
will not be in output and any code within the comment blocks will not be executed.

input comment tag.description:
Displaying something in input view and not
in export view, can be done with an input comment.

non-input comment tag.description:
Displaying something in export view and
not in input view, can be done with a non input comment.

description: Assign tag is used to assign a value to a variable.
When you assign a value to a variable, you will create a string.

With this function you capture the string inside of
the opening and closing tags and assigns it to a variable.
Variables that you create using capture are stored as strings.

To make sure that the content of the template is translated
in different languages, you need to set translation by:
1. indicating the language to which you would like to translate your text; and
2. adding text in that particular language.

body: {% t= "t_${1:key}" default:"${2:default translation}" nl:"${3:NL translation}" fr:"${4:FR translation}" %}
description:
To make sure that the content of the template is translated
in different languages, you need to set translation by:
1. indicating the language to which you would like to translate your text; and
2. adding text in that particular language.

To execute the translation, the word/content
should be placed in brackets with the letter 't' in front of it.

We use an input tag to allow users to enter information in
an input field and to store this information in a custom drop.
Drops can be seen as a "database" and are used to access
data from Silverfin.
To reference an item in a custom drop, you always need
"a namespace" and "a key".

as text attribute.description: When using the "as text", a standard string field is shown as a text field.

as currency attribute.description: When using the "as currency", a standard string field is shown as a numeric value with decimals.

as integer attribute.description: When using the "as integer", a standard string field is shown as an integer value.

as percentage attribute.description: When using the "as percentage", a standard string field is shown as a percentage value.

as boolean attribute.description: When using the "as boolean", a checkbox is created.

autoreload attribute.description: The autoreload attribute automatically reloads the page when the input field is changed.

as date attribute.description: When using the "as date", a standard string field is shown as a date.

as file attribute.description:
Using file as a value for the as attribute gives the opportunity to upload and
attachment or annex that can contain multiple files by clicking the paperclip icon.

description: Render name of the (first) attached documents of a relevant custom value
Render names of all attached documents of a relevant custom value
Render document name of a relevant custom value
Render link to a document preview of a relevant custom value

as select attribute.description: When using the "as select", a dropdown is created.

description:
Account collections are used to be able to pick accounts from a certain range of accounts.

Ranges can be further refined by using comma's and/or double underscores.
The comma's will select individual account ranges.
"4,7": This range will return all 4 and 7 accounts.

Using double underscore will select the entire range of accounts.
"4__7": This range will return all 4, 5, 6 and 7 accounts.

precision attribute.description: Defines the amount of decimals stored for percentage values and in currency configuration

strip insignificant zeros attribute.description: If you set "strip_insignificant_zeros:true", the final decimal zeros from a percentage value will be removed.

description: Customize how the date is displayed inside the input field using the 'format' attribute.
In the 'Date and Time' section there is a list of useful format types that can be applied.
The select value needs to be accompanied by the option attribute.
The option attribute contains a list of possible options which are divided by a pipe |.
Optionally the attribute option_values can be added.

The value returned by the variable will in this case
not be the options presented but the corresponding option value.

When creating an input field, a standard placeholder shown,
is the last part of your variable name (e.g. the key).
It is possible to change the placeholder with the placeholder attribute.

The required attribute allows to change the input field
from a regular one to mandatory field.

In other words, by using required attribute you specify
that the field must be filled out before submitting the form.
Another optional attribute is the default attribute.
It can be used in combination with nearly any type of input tag and it shows a default value.

radiogroup tag.description: Radio button input group tag. Presents a list of answers, of which only one can be selected.

radioinput tag.description: Radio button input tag. Use to add a radio button to a radiogroup.

description: The if statement checks whether a condition is true or false.
If the condition is true, the code within the if statement gets executed.
The else statement is used in combination with the if statement.
If the if statement is false, the else part will be executed.
The elsif statement is used in combination with the if statement.
If the if statement is false, there will be checked if the elsif statement is true.
The if statement checks whether a condition is true or false.
If the condition is true, the code within the if statement gets executed, otherwise the code in the else-statement gets executed

An ifi statement can be seen as an if statement
that is always true in input view and depends on the condition in export view.
The ifi statement can be combined with the elsif and/or else tags.

Code within unless tag will be executed unless the statement is true.
It is the antagonist of the if statement.
The unless statement can be combined with elsif and/or else tags.
The case statement is similar to a series of if statements on the same expression.
In many occasions, you may want to compare the same variable with different variables.
The when statement is used in combination with the case statement.
It is used to check if the case is true.

This is an auto expandable for loop.
So if you for example use input fields:
When you add something to input field and save the template,
the fori loop will automatically add another section.
Use attribute to distinguish between imported collections.
Apply to fori tag for collection name, and inputs for name of fields

index forloop.description: Return the index of the current iteration.

index0 forloop.description: Return the index of the current iteration (zero based).

first forloop.description: Return a boolean checking if this is the first loop.

last forloop.description: Return a boolean checking if this is the last loop.

break forloop tag.description: Causes the loop to stop iterating when it encounters the break tag.

continue forloop tag.description: Causes the loop to continue on the next iteration and skip the current.

limit forloop attribute.description: The limit tag allows to exit the for loop at a specific index.

offset forloop attribute.description: Offset tag allows to start the for loop at a specific index.

reversed forloop attribute.description: Reversed tag allows to reverse the order of the loop.

description:
Unreconciled tags are used to indicate whether or not a template in the working papers
(account or reconciliation template) is reconciled;
this is used quite often and has a direct impact on the progress of the working papers.

When the formula within an unreconciled tag has zero as an outcome (not to be mistaken for empty),
the template will be fully reconciled and a green dot will be visible at the template level.

If you want to reference a certain value or variable from
reconciliation template A in another template, it can be done with the so-called result tags
in Silverfin templating language (further on - STL).
Rollforward is used to copy data from a chosen period to a database variable in the current period.
This is done by pressing the copy data option under the action button in the Silverfin platform.
It is possible to use rollforward.period to check from which period the data is copied.
This can be useful if you only want to rollforward in specific cases.
When using locale with logic tags, you can force a language and ignore the chosen user language.
The code of reconciliation templates is stored in a main part and in 15 optional parts.
The main part is always loaded first, while the additional parts are only loaded when they are called.
The code of reconciliation templates is stored in a main part and in 15 optional parts.
The main part is always loaded first, while the additional parts are only loaded when they are called.
Linkto tags can be used to jump to other templates or to jump to a specific section in the same or another template.

target tag.description: In the target template you should define the target ID.

description: In order to jump to a specific section of a template, you should define the target.
As an example we want to jump to the additional explanation section in template benefit in kind.
Open the specific link in a new tab
Turn the link to into a button

adjustment button tag.description: By using adjustment button tag you can create a button that would automatically make an adjustment, filled with values taken from Liquid logic.

adjustment transaction tag.description: Can only be inside the Adjustment Button.

description: For accounts and reconciliation templates, you need to first close and then open the group tag.
This is due to the fact that the group tag is already opened in advanced settings in styles of the template and/or of the header of the template.

addnewinputs tag.description: We use an addnewinputs tag to allow user sorting information that was stored/added in the collection.

description: The signmarker tag could be used to add the possibility to sign certain documents digitally.
To accomplish that, first you would need to add the signmarker tag in your code, close to where the actual signature would be located.
This will allow to sign the documents through an external provider, which will be able to pick the information given to the signmarker to that end.
Parameters:
name
email
phone
role
on_behalf_of
Push tag will add an item at the end of your array.

pop tag.description: Pop tag will remove the last item of your array and will give you the option to store this value into a variable.

description: If you wish to change the orientation in the PDF export you can use the {% changeorientation “orientation of choice” %} tag.
Keep in mind that the function will apply to everything below and will not close.
Once you have selected "landscape" all the following will appear as landscape.
To revert back to portrait you would need to apply the tag again.
Configure the formatting of "currency" filter within the tag in a template, regardless of the firm/locale level currency display settings

currency configuration zero format attri.description: Set format of zero values in currency configuration

currency configuration negative format a.description: Set format of negative values in currency configuration

description: Insert a page break or start on a new page in the PDF export.
Use to visualize the split between pages in input mode. Use with newpage tag
It removes any newline characters (line breaks) from a string. The tag newline must be used when a break within stripnewlines is needed.

newline table.description: The tag newline must be used when a break within stripnewlines is needed.

indent tag.description: An indentation or indent is a technique that is used to appoint paragraphs or other logical blocks in the code.

font size tag.description: The font tag in combination with the size attribute makes it possible to adjust the size of your text. The size attribute has five possible values: xxs, xs, s, m, l and xl.

font color tag.description: Colors should be avoided in general apart from its use on the disabled titles where light grey can be applied (Hexadecimal code = “CCCCCC”)

infotext inline tag.description: The Silverfin templating language gives the opportunity to add info text. There are 3 ways to present it: as an inline element, as a block or as a hover element.

infotext block tag.description: The Silverfin templating language gives the opportunity to add info text. There are 3 ways to present it: as an inline element, as a block or as a hover element.

infotext hover tag.description: The Silverfin templating language gives the opportunity to add info text. There are 3 ways to present it: as an inline element, as a block or as a hover element.

warningtext inline tag.description: The Silverfin templating language gives the opportunity to add warning text. There are 3 ways to present it: as an inline element, as a block or as a hover element.

warningtext block tag.description: The Silverfin templating language gives the opportunity to add warning text. There are 3 ways to present it: as an inline element, as a block or as a hover element.

Warning Text Hover.description: The Silverfin templating language gives the opportunity to add warning text. There are 3 ways to present it: as an inline element, as a block or as a hover element.

description: Return size of an array or string
Comparison date format: DD/MM/YYYY.
Required for calculations or comparisons between multiple dates.

Localized attribute.description: Set local language to be applied to the input field

abs filter.description: Return the absolute value of a number

ABS function.description: Return absolute value of wrapped input value

description: Rounds the input value up:
ceil:0 to the nearest whole number
ceil:1 to the nearest 0.1
ceil:-1 to the nearest 10
Rounds the input value down:
floor:0 to the nearest whole number
floor:1 to the nearest 0.1
floor:-1 to the nearest 10

currency filter (default).description: Apply currency format with default of 2 decimal places

description: Apply currency format:
currency:0 display no decimal places
currency:2 display 2 decimal places
currency:-3 hide first 3 decimals
Invert value of accounts
Only works with the currency filter

integer filter.description: Convert number to an Integer value

INT function.description: Convert wrapped number to an Integer value

percentage filter (default).description: Apply percentage format with default of two decimal places

description: Apply percentage format:
percentage:0 display no decimal places
percentage:4 display 4 decimal places

number to human filter.description: Output accounts value as combination of integers and English words e.g. 287 thousand

number to currency filter.description: Convert String value into currency format

round filter (default).description: Apply rounding with default of two decimal places

description: Apply rounding:
round:0 round to 0 decimal places
round:4 round to 2 decimal places
round:-1 round to the nearest 10

modulo filter.description: Divide by value and return the remainder

MAX function.description: Apply MAX function to wrapped array

MIN function.description: Apply MIN function to wrapped array

remove filter.description: Remove specified value from a String

replace filter.description: Replace target sub-string with replacement sub-string

capitalize filter.description: Capitalize each word of a String

append filter.description: Add String to the end of a String

prepend filter.description: Add String to the beginning of String

description: Return sub-string of a String
First argument specifies index of starting character
Second argument specifies index of character sub-string goes up to

newline_to_br filter.description: Convert newline characters to HTML line breaks

multiline_table filter.description: Convert newline characters to HTML line breaks

string_value drop.description: Convert variable or drop to a String value

url_encode.description: Encode any url-unsafe characters String into hex

strip_html filter.description: Remove HTML tags from a String

Count drop.description: Return count of all items in drop or collection (integer)

Email drop.description: Return email address of person or user (String)

First drop.description: Return first item in drop or collection (integer)

ID drop.description: Return unique identifier of account or mapping list (String)

Name drop.description: Return name of item. If applied to an array, will return the name of the first item in the array (String)

Value drop.description: Return (sum) value of the drop or collection (Number)

Custom drop.description: Return custom drops with placeholder namespace and key

Accounts drop (with options).description: All drops under the accounts drop

Starred accounts drop.description: Return all starred accounts - must use with variable of type accounts

Starred accounts drop (with options).description: All drops under the starred drop

Assets accounts drop.description: Return all assets accounts - must use with variable of type accounts

Assets accounts drop (with options).description: All drops under the assets drop

Liabilities accounts drop.description: Return all liabilities accounts - must use with variable of type accounts

Liabilities accounts drop (with options).description: All drops under the liabilities drop

Revenue accounts drop.description: Return all revenue accounts - must use with variable of type accounts

Revenue accounts drop (with options).description: All drops under the revenue drop

Expenses accounts drop.description: Return all expenses accounts - must use with variable of type accounts

Expenses accounts drop (with options).description: All drops under the expenses drop

Income accounts drop.description: Return all income accounts - must use with variable of type accounts

Income accounts drop (with options).description: All drops under the income drop

Equity accounts drop.description: Return all equity accounts - must use with variable of type accounts

Equity accounts drop (with options).description: All drops for the equity drop

Accounts credit value drop.description: Return sum of credit value of all selected accounts - must use with variable of type accounts

Accounts debit value drop.description: Return sum of debit value of all selected accounts - must use with variable of type accounts

First - account drop (with options).description: All drops under the account drop

Accounts drop including zeros.description: Return accounts drop, including accounts with a zero balance, from all selected accounts - must use with variable of type accounts

Accounts drop including zeros (with opti.description: All drops for the equity drop

Pnl rounding difference drop.description: Return exact PnL rounding difference when using the core rounding functionality - must use with variable of type accounts

BS rounding difference drop.description: Return exact BS rounding difference when using the core rounding functionality - must use with variable of type accounts

PnL rounding account.description: Return the account used for PnL rounding

BS rounding account.description: Return the account used for BS rounding

Return (account) values in millions.description: Return value of the individual account drops in the selected accounts drop in millions - must use with variable of type accounts

Return (account) values in thousands.description: Return value of the individual account drops in the selected accounts drop in thousands - must use with variable of type accounts

Company drop (with options).description: Return all drops under the Company drop

Dimension/company set drop.description: Returns drop of dimensions/companies in an analytical/consolidation file (drop)

Company form drop.description: Return company form from company settings (String)

Company type drop.description: Return company type from company settings (String)

Company country code drop.description: Return country code, based on country (String)

Company currency drop.description: Return company currency, based on country (String)

Company file code drop.description: Return file number from company settings (String)

Company locales drop.description: Return available languages from company settings (array)

Company periods per year drop.description: Returns 1,4,12 depending on the reporting frequency (integer)

Company postal code drop.description: Return post code from company settings (String)

Company VAT identifier drop.description: Return VAT identifier from company settings (String)

People drop (with options).description: All drops under the People drop

Directors drops (wuth options).description: All drops under the special Directors drop

Shareholders drops (with options).description: All drops under the special Shareholders drop

First - person drop (with options).description: All drops under the person drop

Active as directors filter.description: Return all active directors - must use with special directors drop

Active as directors filter (with options.description: All drops under the active as directors filter

Active as directors on filter.description: Return all active directors on a certain date - must use with special directors drop

Active as directors on filter (with opti.description: All drops under the active as directors on filter

Period drop (with options).description: Return all drops under the Period drop

Accounts drop.description: Return all accounts in the period - must use with variable of type period (drop)

Account mapping list drop (with optiont).description: All drops under the Account Mapping List drop

Marketplace template id drop.description: Return id of Mapping List on the marketplace - must use with variable of type period (integer)

Adjustments drop.description: Return all adjustments in the period - must use with variable of type period (drop)

Bookyear index method.description: Return index of the bookyear in the period (first year is 1) - must use with variable of type period (integer)

Calendar years method.description: Return an array of all calendar years in the fiscal year - must use with variable of type period (array)

Directors drop.description: Return all directors in the period - must use with variable of type period (special drop)

End date drop.description: Return end date of the period - must use with variable of type period (date)

Exists method.description: Return true if the period exists - must use with variable of type period (boolean)

Fiscal year drop.description: Return fiscal year of the period - must use with variable of type period (string)

Is first year method.description: Return true if the period is the first book year of client file - must use with variable of type period (boolean)

Month end dates method.description: Return an array of all month end dates in the fiscal year - must use with variable of type period (array)

People drop.description: Return all people in the period - must use with variable of type period (drop)

Reconciliations drop.description: Return all reconciliations in the period - must use with variable of type period (drop)

Reports drop.description: Return collection of Reports for the period - must use with variable of type period (drop)

Report drop.description: Return specific report for the period - must use with variable of type period (drop)

Shareholders drop.description: Return all shareholders in the period - must use with variable of type period (special drop)

Start date drop.description: Return start date of the period - must use with variable of type period (date)

Year end drop.description: Return period drop of period at end of fiscal year - must use with variable of type period (drop)

Year end date drop.description: Return end date of the fiscal year - must use with variable of type period (date)

Year start date drop.description: Return start date of the fiscal year - must use with variable of type period (date)

Minus period/year.description: Return period before current period by a set number of periods or year - must use with variable of type period (drop)

Plus period/year.description: Return period after current period by a set number of periods or year - must use with variable of type period (drop)

Reconciliations drop (with options).description: All drops under the Reconciliations drop

Starred reconciliations drop.description: Return all starred reconciliations - must use with variable of type reconciliations (drop)

Starred reconciliations drop (with optio.description: All drops under the Starred Reconciliation drop

User drops (with options).description: Return all drops under the User drop

HTML line right class.description: HTML create line to the right of text class

HTML double line top class.description: HTML create line above text class

HTML double line bottom class.description: HTML create line under text class

HTML double line left class.description: HTML create line to the left of text class
